intro: Lactuca mira, commonly known as the beautiful lettuce, is a species of flowering plant in the daisy family, Asteraceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers and rosette-forming leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters and prefers well-drained soil and full sun. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits. Lactuca mira is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
